page.title: 04FARMING IN NORTH KEWSTOKE
page.content: Much of the farmland in this area is low lying and requires extensive draining which is done by a system of rhynes and ditches.These need regular attention by the Water Authority and individual farmers. The land in the main is used for the upkeep and grazing of animals.One farm has 1200 sheep and 200 cows.Most of the fields that are not used for grazing grow grass to produce hay and silage.Recently one farm has been forced by E.E.C regulations to restrict their output of milk.They have done this by using some of their fields to grow wheat and barley which is used for animal feeding.This same farm has joined forces with the National Trust to plant trees on the farm such as ash and turkey oak to replace the elm trees recently lost.
